docs.text: based on the novel set in 1914 by joseph conrad , victory spins a tale of a pair of lovers , heyst ( william dafoe ) and alma ( irene jacob ) , who seek refuge on heyst's isolated island .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , their idyllic world begins to crumble upon the arrival of mr jones ( sam neil ) , martin ricardo ( rufus sewell ) and their servant , pedro ( graziano marcelli ) , who have come to steal heyst's rumoured plunder .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while the novel is largely complex in characterization , the film sadly transposes conrad's characters into lacklustre leads , the most disappointing being heyst himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: conrad's heyst adheres religiously to his late father's ways of detachment and isolation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his ascetic lifestyle is thrown into question when he meets alma , a helpless orchestra girl who charms him with her voice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the struggle to embrace the arrival of alma into his solitude , however , is lost in mark peploe's ( director and writer ) diluted version of heyst .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: without properly establishing the crucial details of heyst's character , all that is left of conrad's main character is a very shallow treatment of his internal conflict between detachment and human involvement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: on the one hand , actualizing the subtext is a mammoth task ( though not impossible ) , but on the other hand , dafoe's flat acting cannot be excused as an attempt at stoicism .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the end , we are supposed to witness heyst renounce his philosophy and finally come to an understanding of what it is to love another .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the final transformation , while perceptible , lacks the cathartic revelation which is undeniable in conrad's novel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: its absence in the film is unforgivable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film seems more concerned about moving the plot along when so much has yet to be said about the relationship between the two complete strangers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: alma is supposed to have overcome great emotional barriers in the relationship , namely heyst's underlying philosophy of detachment , which heyst himself grapples with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the struggle against heyst's ignorance of true human involvement accounts for much of the greatness of alma's love for him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jacob , fair-skinned , gentle and yet passionate , handles the role with precision , detailing nuances where possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , she is let down by a superficial script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the couple's relationship develops too hastily , leaving all subtlety effaced and replaced with a blatant show-and-tell approach .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all we know of the characters are mostly explained by their lines alone .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is unsatisfactory when so much of the turmoil experienced by the two stem from their buried thoughts and emotions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the sketchy handling of their relationship stands out as sorely as dafoe's american accent ( an inappropriate one since heyst spent most of his life in london ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the other characters such as schomberg ( jean yanne ) , the owner of a hotel , and mr jones ( sam neill ) , also fall short of conrad's meticulous characterization .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while schomberg should have been more menacing and vindictive , mr jones should have been portrayed as something more of an enigma .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sam neil's caricature of a slightly stout , effeminate and soft-spoken gentleman-at-large nullifies the effect intended by conrad who describes mr jones as " an insolent spectre on leave from hades , endowed with skin and bones and a subtle power of terror " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: poor characterization aside , kudos goes to rufus sewell for his excellent portrayal of ricardo , secretary to mr jones , a reckless ruffian capable of murder .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sewell , with his cockney accent and large expressive green eyes , becomes the true terror of the unholy trinity , masterminding deceitful plans behind jones' back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at the same time , we are entertained by the foolhardiness of his plans .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: despite the authentic setting and marvellous cinematography by bruno de keyzer , very few images are left behind for us to savour after the film has ended .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sourabaya and its surrounding islands and volcanoes may have their charm , but mean nothing once the film fails to capture the essence of an epic , which is what victory deserves to be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the delicately inter-woven complexities in the love story are lost to an inadequate production .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at the end of the film , we are told that perhaps alma's victory was in teaching heyst how to love .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a hollow victory indeed .
docs.label: negative
